lang.BUBBLE_SORT_ALGORITHM: Optimized Bubble Sort is a modification of the standard Bubble Sort algorithm aimed at improving its performance by reducing the number of unnecessary passes through the list.
lang.BUBBLE_SORT_ALGORITHM_0: The main idea of Optimized Bubble Sort is that after each pass, the largest unsorted element in the array is placed in its correct position. This means that we can reduce the length of the next pass since the sorted portion of the array is already at the end.
lang.BUBBLE_SORT_ALGORITHM_15: This algorithm uses the 'swapped' variable to track whether any element swaps occur during each pass. If no swaps occur, 'swapped' remains false, and we terminate the sorting. Decreasing 'len' after each pass helps reduce the length of the next pass since the largest element is already in its correct position.
lang.BUBBLE_SORT_ALGORITHM_16: This algorithm can be used to sort arrays or lists of any type that support comparison and element swapping.
lang.BUBBLE_SORT_HINT: Find a pair of adjacent elements in the array that satisfy the condition A > B and move them to the Swap field.
